alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 15 at 2:04PM CST until December 15 at 2:15PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CST FOR CLAY...WESTERN NUCKOLLS...EASTERN WEBSTER...EASTERN ADAMS... SOUTHWESTERN HAMILTON...NORTHEASTERN BUFFALO...SOUTHWESTERN MERRICK...EASTERN SHERMAN...HOWARD AND HALL COUNTIES... At 204 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Ashton to near St. Libory to Glenvil, moving northeast at 85 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... St. Libory around 210 PM CST. Giltner around 215 PM CST. Stockham around 220 PM CST. Aurora around 225 PM CST. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 303 and 332. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for north central Kansas...and south central and central Nebraska. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
